solution_line_template: Georgia's test started with {total_problems} problems and then Georgia completed {initial_completed}, {total_problems} - {initial_completed} = <<{total_problems}-{initial_completed}={remaining_after_initial}>>{remaining_after_initial} problems.
After 20 minutes she completes twice as many problems, {initial_completed} x {multiplier_twice} = <<{initial_completed}*{multiplier_twice}={completed_second_batch}>>{completed_second_batch}.
With 40 minutes left she has completed {initial_completed} + {completed_second_batch} problems = <<{initial_completed}+{completed_second_batch}={total_completed}>>{total_completed} problems.

From the original {total_problems} problems she has solved {total_completed}, {total_problems} - {total_completed} = <<{total_problems}-{total_completed}={problems_left}>>{problems_left} problems she has left.
